newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan electronics rise on rising DRAM prices.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan electronics rise on rising DRAM prices.

text.p: Taiwan's electronics shares rose sharply in late Wednesday trade despite a weak market as prices for dynamic random access memory chips have rebounded in international markets, brokers said.
With 40 minutes left, the most active issue, Acer Inc, had jumped T$1.9 or 4.96 percent to T$40.2. Macronix was up 90 cents or 2.67 percent to T$34.6.
Many local electronic firms, including Acer, were forced to slash their 1996 profit forecasts due to recently tumbling DRAM prices, said Tank Hung of Yuan Ta Securities.
"The rebound in DRAM prices is expected to boost the companies' performance significantly," Hung said.
Many foreign funds have actively bought blue chip electronics shares since Morgan Stanley began including Taiwan in its global indices on September 2, brokers said.
